meanings.definition: To compare or liken two things using analogy.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys analogizing different animals to explain complex ideas.
meanings.sent2: He is good at analogizing historical events to current situations.
meanings.sent3: The teacher was analogizing the solar system to a giant clock, which made the students giggle.
meanings.sent4: Analogizing the human brain to a computer can help us understand its functions better.
meanings.sent5: Analogizing is like creating a bridge between two different worlds of thought.

meanings.definition: To draw a comparison between two things.
meanings.sent1: The author is analogizing the protagonist to a real-life hero in the story.
meanings.sent2: By analogizing the economy to a rollercoaster, he made the concept easier to grasp.
meanings.sent3: The comedian was analogizing his messy room to a jungle, which got the audience laughing.
meanings.sent4: Analogizing the journey of life to a winding river can be quite poetic.
meanings.sent5: Analogizing is like connecting dots between different ideas to see a bigger picture.
